    • Uses of MenuComponent in moulton.scalable.clickables

      Subclasses of MenuComponent in moulton.scalable.clickables 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  Button
      A menu component that is a simple rectangular button with optional frontal text saved as Button.text.
      class  Clickable
      Ancestor class for components that are clickable.
      class  RadioButton
      A button where only one in the group can be clicked at a time.

    • Uses of MenuComponent in moulton.scalable.containers

      Subclasses of MenuComponent in moulton.scalable.containers 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  ListPanel
      A subclass of PanelPlus.
      class  Panel
      A panel to serve as a parent component and backdrop for other MenuComponents.
      class  PanelPlus
      An improved Panel class that can be scrolled and can thus hold hidden elements.
      class  PartitionPanel
      PartitionPanel is a type of Panel with up to two partitions dividing up the space into four sectors: left, right, bottom, and top.
      Fields in moulton.scalable.containers declared as MenuComponent 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected MenuComponent PartitionPanel.bottom
      The menu component drawn in the specified sector.
      protected MenuComponent PartitionPanel.left
      The menu component drawn in the specified sector.
      protected MenuComponent PartitionPanel.right
      The menu component drawn in the specified sector.
      protected MenuComponent PartitionPanel.top
      The menu component drawn in the specified sector.

      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected java.util.LinkedList<MenuComponent> Panel.comps
      A list of the components held in free-form.
      Methods in moulton.scalable.containers that return types with arguments of type MenuComponent 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.ArrayList<MenuComponent> Panel.getAllHeldComponents()
      Returns a list of all of the child components that this panel holds.
      java.util.ArrayList<MenuComponent> PartitionPanel.getAllHeldComponents()  
      Methods in moulton.scalable.containers with parameters of type MenuComponent 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean ListPanel.addComponent​(MenuComponent comp, int listIndex)
      Inserts a component to the list at the specified index.
      boolean ListPanel.addFreeComponent​(MenuComponent comp)
      The ListPanel stores elements in a vertical list.
      boolean Panel.addFreeComponent​(MenuComponent comp)
      Adds a component to the list of free component components.
      boolean PartitionPanel.addFreeComponent​(MenuComponent comp)
      This method is overridden and only returns false because PartitionPanel requires components to be added in a very specific way.
      boolean ListPanel.addToGrid​(MenuComponent comp, int x, int y)
      The ListPanel stores elements in a vertical list.
      boolean Panel.addToGrid​(MenuComponent comp, int x, int y)
      Called by the constructor of supported MenuComponents to add the component to this panel's grid.
      boolean PartitionPanel.addToGrid​(MenuComponent comp, int x, int y)
      This method is overridden and only returns false because PartitionPanel requires components to be added in a very specific way.
      int[] Panel.getRenderOffset​(MenuComponent comp)
      Although Panel tells its children components to render where they truly are on the screen, offset is allowed to be use in subclasses.
      int[] PanelPlus.getRenderOffset​(MenuComponent comp)
      The PanelPlus gets the offset from its parent panel (Panel.getRenderOffset(MenuComponent)), then adds the offset this has saved from the last render, saved as PanelPlus.lastX and PanelPlus.lastY.
      int[][] Panel.handleOffsets​(int[] xs, int[] ys, MenuComponent callingComp)
      It is very frequent that components need their true coordinates for action in relation to the mouse (such as in mouse clicking or scrolling) or other uses.
      boolean Panel.removeFreeComponent​(MenuComponent comp)
      Searches through this component's Panel.comps to delete the component.
      void PartitionPanel.setBottom​(MenuComponent comp)
      Sets the component in the bottom sector.
      void PartitionPanel.setLeft​(MenuComponent comp)
      Sets the component in the left sector.
      void PartitionPanel.setRight​(MenuComponent comp)
      Sets the component in the right sector.
      void PartitionPanel.setTop​(MenuComponent comp)
      Sets the component in the top sector.
      Method parameters in moulton.scalable.containers with type arguments of type MenuComponent

    • Uses of MenuComponent in moulton.scalable.geometrics

      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  Line
      A simple line from two points on the (x,y) plane.
      class  Polygon
      A aesthetic menu component in a polygonal shape determined by Polygon.xs and Polygon.ys.
      class  PolygonalButton
      A menu component button in the shape of a polygon as opposed to a rectangle

    • Uses of MenuComponent in moulton.scalable.texts

      Subclasses of MenuComponent in moulton.scalable.texts 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  Caption
      A menu component to display text on a panel.
      class  StaticTextBox
      In some instances, the user will find it useful to select and/or copy text from a text box, but should not be able to edit its values.
      class  TextBox
      This is a text box that users can enter data into, the available characters for which is defined by TextFormat.
      class  TextHistory
      A menu component that holds a history of text.
